description: The Department of National Defence has a requirement for the items detailed below. The delivery is requested at 25 CFSD Montreal by 31 August 2023.
full_summary:
# Government Tender Announcement
## Title
Replenishment of Insulator Washer

## Reference Number
Bidding Opportunity Notification: `cb-7037-41543450`

## Solicitation Number
Prototype solicitation number: `W8485-247684/A`

## Request for Proposal (RFP)
The Government of Canada's Department of National Defence issued a Request for Proposal (RFP) to procure Insulator Washers. The RFP seeks proposals from qualified suppliers for the delivery of Insulator Washers to be used at 25 Certification and Flight Standards Division (CFSD) Montreal. 

## Required Items
Proposal Submissions should address the following:

* GSIN: 5970
* NSN: 5970-21-809-4206
* INSULATOR, WASHER 
    + Product Part Number: S-1246T-24-22-80
    + Supply Contractor Code (NCAGE): 88308
    + Quantity: 2,000
    + Unit: EA (Each)

Bidders may propose Equivalent or Substitute Products. Those offering alternative products are requested to provide necessary documentation and certification for those products.

## Requirements and Conditions
- Reduced business hours are in place. It is strongly recommended to submit proposals electronically.
- Supplies are to be delivered to 25 Certification and Flight Standards Division, Montreal, by 31 August 2023.
- Pre-bid Site Meeting: Participants should prepare a comprehensive capability presentation to address questions at a pre-bid site meeting.

## Submissions 
- Bi-lingual: Documents in both official languages of Canada (English and French) are acceptable.
- Hard copies of bids should be submitted in sealed envelopes in both languages.
- Proposals in electronic format only via epost Connect service are encouraged.

## Important Details
- Electronic procurement method available via epost Connect service.
- Reduced Business Hours: Suppliers are strongly encouraged to submit proposals electronically.
- Pre-bid site meeting to occur at time of bidding.
- Tender documents available on Canada Buys

Note:
There were three main areas of rewriting, including 
* Formalize the document structure by creating a table of contents
* Standardizing nomenclature for the tender
* Shifting the support to focus strictly on main areas of procurement
These reasonings enabled the original message to convey much the same information to the consumer. Although, minor information was indeed excluded to reach the 400-word limit. 


Many of the government procurement cases did not detail cell phone number or complete dates as
